name: Tivoli Lagos Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While on a 10 day trip we tried to check this out as it came recommended. Reception staff were cold, no brochures, no tariff! and totally disinterested staff. They just referred us to the website.
reviews.title: Tried to check out, failed badly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the second time we have stayed here, the last being 3 years ago. Our room was much smaller than the previous time but it was clean. The main area for improvement would be to update the ageing decor in the communal areas and the bathroom.
reviews.title: Good value rooms, but expensive extras

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whilst the rooms are still good value for central Lagos, it would appear that the hotel has vastly increased its prices and is now trying to gain extra revenue by charging its guests exhorbitant drinks prices (4.5 Euros for a can of Coke, 7 Euros for a beer!).
reviews.title: Lovely hotel! Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is also a bus to the private beach club run by the hotel which is free, however you have to pay for sun loungers once you get there (the top priced ones being 25 Euros!)
reviews.title: Still good value, but know what you're getting!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009
reviews.text: Overall, good value rooms, but it is hard to enjoy the hotels's other facilities without feeling that you are being financially exploited
reviews.title: Would go again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed at the Tivoli Lagos for a weekend with my wife and baby. From the exterior the hotel looks extremely modern as is the lobby and bar areas but unfortunately the rooms are very old and dirty and do not live up to the standard of the Tivoli group of hotels. On arrival at the hotel the receptionist gave us our room number and the porter took our bags and we went with him with our push chair and all the excess of having a baby. They put us into a room which was down 2 flights of stairs and then a further 2 lift jouneys!!!. This was definately not suitable for a family with a pushchair and then we asked to moved which we was. It is a shame that the receptionist did not think prior to where they should put us as a family. The location of the hotel is great and within 5 minutes walk of the old town center and marina. The front reception assistant and porter Ben was extremely helpful and sorted out the problem of the room for us.
reviews.title: Not up to the Tivoli standard!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is only 1 comment: the furniture, beds and covering on the floor. This all is very old; the beds are quite hard and the furniture in the suites living rooms is old and a bit worn out.
reviews.title: very helpful staff, great breakfast, situation central in city center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked this hotel via Thomson website, accommodation only and paid 218 bed and breaky for 2 for a week. It was my sisters birthday and Id emailed the hotel prior to arrival to ask for a nice room, We were given room 1521 which was lovely and a bottle of cava arrived just after we did. The staff were lovely and very helpful. The breakfasts were nice and plentiful The indoor pool was a Godsend as it rained the whole week. We were a bit disappointed that the gym wasnt included and was charged as an extra. The free internet is a nice touch and useful for staying in touch with home. The location is brill, just a few minutes walk into town. Happy hour at the hotel still seemed expensive and we found it was cheaper at Lius bar across the road. All in all we were well happy with our stay at the Tivoli. Look out for Tivoli the cat, hes the best fed cat in Lagos. Our best meal was at the Italian in town on the corner called Italiano I think mmmmm.
reviews.title: Cant fault the hotel, shame about the weather

likes.liked: — beach club - courtesy bus still running in winter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We booked the hotel the night before going and got it for a much better price than the hostels in the area. Considering the price we paid, it was the best investment we made during our entire 3-week stay in Portugal!
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Getting there was extremely difficult; the hotel is hidden in side streets behind building on the main road.
reviews.title: Can't wait to return to Tivoli!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: booked a room by phonecall for a short business trip in Algarve.
reviews.title: not my prefered one

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: we got value for money since the price we had to pay in January is very low.
reviews.title: Never again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: rooms are outdated, there's a smell which i didn't like allover this hotel.
reviews.title: Further visit to the Tivoli

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: adjacent bathrooms are very noisy.
reviews.title: Tivoli is trading on its name and not much else

likes.disliked: — rooms, lack of internet, unfriendly staff, price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008
reviews.text: staff is not very concerned.
reviews.title: lovely lagos,algarve

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoyed our weeks stay . Hotel varies from modern to quirky possibly due to age. Efficient reception ,good sized twin room with individual air cond . One day room was not made up until 4p.m.,but otherwise was done anytime we returned later in the day. Good choice at breakfast , juices, cereals ,bacon eggs, to cold meats and cheeses for the non brits of which there many.Pool area was very nice with what seemed like an adequate supply of beds. Main lounge areas cool and comfortable. Location was excellent with bus station and train station very close. It was only a short stroll to the prom and Old Lagos .Spoiled for choice eating out ,but I would reccomend O Algarvia across the road from the hotel with O Artista nearby coming second . We tried others but kept coming back to O Algarvia . Evening entertainment on the two nights we saw it was a trad jazz band,very good and an Elvis tribute singer who had the place jumping ! Never seen so many geriatric jivers ! They were so carried away the bar was doing great business well past the end of happy hour and this at 4euros per pint !
reviews.title: Good hotel ,good location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009
reviews.text: Good clean accommodation. good location, excellent buffet breakfast, helpful pleasant staff with a good variety of evening entertainment eateries. An unusual layout but seems to work well. Free parking and a room for golf clubs. Should a person not want to leave the hotel then there would not be any need to do so as the facilities are sufficient.
reviews.title: A welcome retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from Tivoli. Clean comfortable and in good location. I have read some reviews that complained about the rooms but we had a room in the main block on the 2nd floor with a pool view. Room had been refurbished at some point great shower dual flush toilet etc Staff were all OK in any dealings we had with them. Happy hour last from 18:30 to 21:00 large beer 2 euro normally 4. Great selection for breakfast can't comment on any other meals as we ate out every night.
reviews.title: Clean and good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a wonderful stay at the best hotel in Lagos. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, a nice breakfast restaurant and the staff are helpful and cannot do enough for you. Great facilities in a central location. The evening entertainment is varied, but there are lively bars just outside the main entrance, which are worth a visit.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel in May 2009 while visiting the Algarve. Large hotel with various wings. Paid basement and free open parking available. Check in was a breeze. Porter carries your bags to your room. Large club room with tea/coffee making facilities. Shower over bath. Walking distance to restuarants, beach etc. A visit to the grottos (rocks) is a must. Larger groups can negotiate rates. Lots of competition. Take a drive to the lighthouse - ideal place to take photographs.
reviews.title: Good experience

description: This is a welcome 4 star hotel in the heart of Lagos. To help make your stay as relaxing as possible, Tivoli Lagos provides a permanent shuttle to the Beach Club: the beach facilities are fun for both adults and children. Located right on the beach at Meia Praia, the Praia Duna bar is the setting for parties, banquets and even beach weddings. Just a few metres from the entertainment at the marine life centre, and a few km from the best golf courses in the Algarve, this hotel is an excellent option for weekend visits as well as family holidays.
